p: Despite its high ecological and cultural value landscapes, the islandâ€™s natural ecosystems have been greatly degraded [ 18, 21]. The smooth topography with medium inclinations allowed intense human activities to take place on almost the entire island. Extended agriculture, tourism facilities, and the traditional agropastoral practice of burning and intense grazing (sheep and goats) have drastically affected the formation of natural ecosystems and their vegetative composition [ 18].
